name: Ticket Categorization
description: Find and set the Ticket Category (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

code.value:
# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
import re
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from zenpy import Zenpy
from zenpy.lib.api_objects import Ticket, Comment


class CustomComponent(Component):
    display_name = "ZenDesk Ticket Comments"
    description = "Get ZenDesk Ticket Comments"
    documentation: str = ""
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "ZenDesk Ticket Comments"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="ticket_id", display_name="Ticket ID", value=""),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="zendesk_api_key",
            display_name="ZenDesk API Key",
            info="The ZenDesk API Key",
            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_KEY",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="zendesk_api_email",
            display_name="ZenDesk API Email",
            info="The ZenDesk API Email",
            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_EMAIL",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="zendesk_api_subdomain",
            display_name="ZenDesk API Subdomain",
            info="The ZenDesk API Subdomain",
            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_SUBDOMAIN",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Ticket Comments", name="comments", method="build_comments"),
    ]

    def build_comments(self) -> Data:
        credentials = {
            'email' : self.zendesk_api_email,
            'token' : self.zendesk_api_key,
            'subdomain': self.zendesk_api_subdomain
        }
        zenpy_client = Zenpy(**credentials)
        comments = zenpy_client.tickets.comments(ticket=self.ticket_id)
        plain_comments = []
        for comment in comments:
            #plain_comments.append(comment.plain_body)
            image_urls = []
            if comment.attachments:
                for attachment in comment.attachments:
                    image_urls.append(attachment.content_url)
            
            body = comment.body
            image_urls_by_regex = []
            pattern = re.compile(r"\((https?:\/\/support\.flowbots\.ninja\/attachments\S+\.\w+)\)?")
            image_urls_by_regex += pattern.findall(body)
            
            for image_url in image_urls_by_regex:
                image_urls.append(image_url)
            
            plain_comments.append({
                "plain_body": comment.plain_body,
                "created": comment.created,
                "author": str(comment.author),
                "name": comment.author.name,
                "image_urls": image_urls
            })

        data = Data(value=plain_comments)
        self.status = data
        return data
code.name: code

code.value:
import re
import base64
import requests

from urllib.parse import urlparse
from urllib.parse import parse_qs

from langchain_community.document_loaders.web_base import WebBaseLoader

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output, DataInput, IntInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.inputs import (
    SecretStrInput,
)

from openai import OpenAI


class URLComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Create Openai Image IDs"
    description = "Fetch content from one or more image URLs and create the Openai File IDs."
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "Openai File IDs"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(
            name="comments",
            display_name="Ticket Comments",
            info="Ticket Comments"
        ),
        IntInput(name="idx", display_name="Index", value=0),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="openai_api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Openai Image IDs", name="data", method="fetch_content"),
    ]

    def ensure_url(self, string: str) -> str:
        """
        Ensures the given string is a URL by adding 'http://' if it doesn't start with 'http://' or 'https://'.
        Raises an error if the string is not a valid URL.

        Parameters:
            string (str): The string to be checked and possibly modified.

        Returns:
            str: The modified string that is ensured to be a URL.

        Raises:
            ValueError: If the string is not a valid URL.
        """
        if not string.startswith(("http://", "https://")):
            string = "http://" + string

        # Basic URL validation regex
        url_regex = re.compile(
            r"^(https?:\/\/)?"  # optional protocol
            r"(www\.)?"  # optional www
            r"([a-zA-Z0-9.-]+)"  # domain
            r"(\.[a-zA-Z]{2,})?"  # top-level domain
            r"(:\d+)?"  # optional port
            r"(\/[^\s]*)?$",  # optional path
            re.IGNORECASE,
        )

        if not url_regex.match(string):
            raise ValueError(f"Invalid URL: {string}")

        return string

    def fetch_content(self) -> list[Data]:
        openai_api_key = self.openai_api_key
        client = OpenAI(api_key=openai_api_key)
        
        urls = self.comments.value[self.idx]["image_urls"]
        if len(urls) <= 0:
            self.status = []
            return []
        
        image_ids = []
        
        for image_url in urls:
            response = requests.get(image_url)
            if response.status_code == 200:
                parsed_url = urlparse(image_url)
                file_name = parse_qs(parsed_url.query)['name'][0]
                if file_name.endswith((".jpeg", ".jpg", ".png", ".gif", ".webp")):
                    file = client.files.create(
                        file=(f"{file_name.lower()}", response.content),
                        purpose="assistants",
                    )
                    image_ids.append(file.id)
        
        #urls = [self.ensure_url(url.strip()) for url in self.urls if url.strip()]
        #loader = WebBaseLoader(web_paths=urls, encoding="utf-8")
        #docs = loader.load()
        #data = [Data(content=doc.page_content, **doc.metadata) for doc in docs]
        data = image_ids
        self.status = data
        return data

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node
code.name: code

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.helpers.data import data_to_text
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, MultilineInput, Output, StrInput, IntInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ParseDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Ticket Comments Plain Body"
    description = "Return the Ticket Comments plain body"
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "Ticket Comments Plain Body"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="Ticket Comments", info="Ticket Comments"),
        IntInput(name="idx", display_name="Index", value="0"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Plain Body", name="text", method="parse_data"),
    ]

    def parse_data(self) -> Message:
        plain_body = self.data.value[self.idx]["plain_body"]
        self.status = plain_body
        return Message(text=plain_body)

# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
import re
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output, IntInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from zenpy import Zenpy
from zenpy.lib.api_objects import Ticket, Comment


class CustomComponent(Component):
    display_name = "ZenDesk Ticket Comments"
    description = "Get ZenDesk Ticket Comments"
    documentation: str = ""
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "ZenDesk Ticket Comments"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="ticket_id", display_name="Ticket ID", value=""),
        MessageTextInput(name="category", display_name="Category", value=""),
        IntInput(name="category_field_id", display_name="Category Field ID", value=0),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="zendesk_api_key",
            display_name="ZenDesk API Key",
            info="The ZenDesk API Key",
            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_KEY",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="zendesk_api_email",
            display_name="ZenDesk API Email",
            info="The ZenDesk API Email",
            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_EMAIL",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="zendesk_api_subdomain",
            display_name="ZenDesk API Subdomain",
            info="The ZenDesk API Subdomain",
            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_SUBDOMAIN",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Category", name="category_output", method="update_ticket"),
    ]

    def update_ticket(self) -> Message:
        credentials = {
            'email' : self.zendesk_api_email,
            'token' : self.zendesk_api_key,
            'subdomain': self.zendesk_api_subdomain
        }
        zenpy_client = Zenpy(**credentials)
        
        ticket = zenpy_client.tickets(id=self.ticket_id)

        #ticket.tags.append(self.category)
        for custom_field in ticket.custom_fields:
            if self.category_field_id == custom_field["id"]: # category
                custom_field["value"] = self.category
        
        ticket_audit = zenpy_client.tickets.update(ticket)
        
        #message = Message(text=str(ticket_audit.ticket.id))
        message = Message(text=self.category)
        self.status = message
        return message

# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
import re
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from zenpy import Zenpy
from zenpy.lib.api_objects import Ticket, Comment


class CustomComponent(Component):
    display_name = "ZenDesk Ticket Subject"
    description = "Get ZenDesk Ticket Subject"
    documentation: str = ""
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "ZenDesk Ticket Subject"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="ticket_id", display_name="Ticket ID", value=""),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="zendesk_api_key",
            display_name="ZenDesk API Key",
            info="The ZenDesk API Key",
            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_KEY",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="zendesk_api_email",
            display_name="ZenDesk API Email",
            info="The ZenDesk API Email",
            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_EMAIL",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="zendesk_api_subdomain",
            display_name="ZenDesk API Subdomain",
            info="The ZenDesk API Subdomain",
            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_SUBDOMAIN",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Ticket Subject", name="text", method="build_subject"),
    ]

    def build_subject(self) -> Message:
        credentials = {
            'email' : self.zendesk_api_email,
            'token' : self.zendesk_api_key,
            'subdomain': self.zendesk_api_subdomain
        }
        zenpy_client = Zenpy(**credentials)
        ticket = zenpy_client.tickets(id=self.ticket_id)
        subject = ticket.subject
        self.status = subject
        return Message(text=subject)

from axiestudio.base.data.utils import IMG_FILE_TYPES, TEXT_FILE_TYPES
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FileInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"
    name = "ChatInput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            value="",
            info="Message to be passed as input.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=["Machine", "User"],
            value="User",
            info="Type of sender.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value="User",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id", display_name="Session ID", info="Session ID for the message.", advanced=True
        ),
        FileInput(
            name="files",
            display_name="Files",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES + IMG_FILE_TYPES,
            info="Files to be sent with the message.",
            advanced=True,
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
            files=self.files,
        )

        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=["Machine", "User"],
            value="Machine",
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name", display_name="Sender Name", info="Name of the sender.", value="AI", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id", display_name="Session ID", info="Session ID for the message.", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

import re
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from zenpy import Zenpy
from zenpy.lib.api_objects import Ticket, Comment


class CustomComponent(Component):
    display_name = "ZenDesk Ticket Comments"

            name="zendesk_api_subdomain",

            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_SUBDOMAIN",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [

        credentials = {
            'email' : self.zendesk_api_email,
            'token' : self.zendesk_api_key,
            'subdomain': self.zendesk_api_subdomain

            image_urls = []
            if comment.attachments:
                for attachment in comment.attachments:
                    image_urls.append(attachment.content_url)
            
            body = comment.body
            image_urls_by_regex = []
            pattern = re.compile(r"\((https?:\/\/support\.flowbots\.ninja\/attachments\S+\.\w+)\)?")
            image_urls_by_regex += pattern.findall(body)
            
            for image_url in image_urls_by_regex:
                image_urls.append(image_url)
            
            plain_comments.append({
                "plain_body": comment.plain_body,
                "created": comment.created,
                "author": str(comment.author),
                "name": comment.author.name,
                "image_urls": image_urls
            })

        data = Data(value=plain_comments)
        self.status = data
        return data

import re
import base64
import requests

from urllib.parse import urlparse
from urllib.parse import parse_qs

from langchain_community.document_loaders.web_base import WebBaseLoader

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output, DataInput, IntInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.inputs import (
    SecretStrInput,
)

from openai import OpenAI


class URLComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Create Openai Image IDs"
    description = "Fetch content from one or more image URLs and create the Openai File IDs."
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "Openai File IDs"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(
            name="comments",
            display_name="Ticket Comments",
            info="Ticket Comments"
        ),
        IntInput(name="idx", display_name="Index", value=0),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="openai_api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Openai Image IDs", name="data", method="fetch_content"),
    ]

    def ensure_url(self, string: str) -> str:
        """
        Ensures the given string is a URL by adding 'http://' if it doesn't start with 'http://' or 'https://'.
        Raises an error if the string is not a valid URL.

        Parameters:
            string (str): The string to be checked and possibly modified.

        Returns:
            str: The modified string that is ensured to be a URL.

        Raises:
            ValueError: If the string is not a valid URL.
        """
        if not string.startswith(("http://", "https://")):
            string = "http://" + string

        # Basic URL validation regex
        url_regex = re.compile(
            r"^(https?:\/\/)?"  # optional protocol
            r"(www\.)?"  # optional www
            r"([a-zA-Z0-9.-]+)"  # domain
            r"(\.[a-zA-Z]{2,})?"  # top-level domain
            r"(:\d+)?"  # optional port
            r"(\/[^\s]*)?$",  # optional path
            re.IGNORECASE,
        )

        if not url_regex.match(string):
            raise ValueError(f"Invalid URL: {string}")

        return string

    def fetch_content(self) -> list[Data]:
        openai_api_key = self.openai_api_key
        client = OpenAI(api_key=openai_api_key)
        
        urls = self.comments.value[self.idx]["image_urls"]
        if len(urls) <= 0:
            self.status = []
            return []
        
        image_ids = []
        
        for image_url in urls:
            response = requests.get(image_url)
            if response.status_code == 200:
                parsed_url = urlparse(image_url)
                file_name = parse_qs(parsed_url.query)['name'][0]
                if file_name.endswith((".jpeg", ".jpg", ".png", ".gif", ".webp")):
                    file = client.files.create(
                        file=(f"{file_name.lower()}", response.content),
                        purpose="assistants",
                    )
                    image_ids.append(file.id)
        
        #urls = [self.ensure_url(url.strip()) for url in self.urls if url.strip()]
        #loader = WebBaseLoader(web_paths=urls, encoding="utf-8")
        #docs = loader.load()
        #data = [Data(content=doc.page_content, **doc.metadata) for doc in docs]
        data = image_ids
        self.status = data
        return data

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node
code.name: code

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.helpers.data import data_to_text
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, MultilineInput, Output, StrInput, IntInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ParseDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Ticket Comments Plain Body"
    description = "Return the Ticket Comments plain body"
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "Ticket Comments Plain Body"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="Ticket Comments", info="Ticket Comments"),
        IntInput(name="idx", display_name="Index", value="0"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Plain Body", name="text", method="parse_data"),
    ]

    def parse_data(self) -> Message:
        plain_body = self.data.value[self.idx]["plain_body"]
        self.status = plain_body
        return Message(text=plain_body)

# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
import re
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output, IntInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from zenpy import Zenpy
from zenpy.lib.api_objects import Ticket, Comment


class CustomComponent(Component):
    display_name = "ZenDesk Ticket Comments"
    description = "Get ZenDesk Ticket Comments"
    documentation: str = ""
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "ZenDesk Ticket Comments"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="ticket_id", display_name="Ticket ID", value=""),
        MessageTextInput(name="category", display_name="Category", value=""),
        IntInput(name="category_field_id", display_name="Category Field ID", value=0),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="zendesk_api_key",
            display_name="ZenDesk API Key",
            info="The ZenDesk API Key",
            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_KEY",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="zendesk_api_email",
            display_name="ZenDesk API Email",
            info="The ZenDesk API Email",
            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_EMAIL",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="zendesk_api_subdomain",
            display_name="ZenDesk API Subdomain",
            info="The ZenDesk API Subdomain",
            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_SUBDOMAIN",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Category", name="category_output", method="update_ticket"),
    ]

    def update_ticket(self) -> Message:
        credentials = {
            'email' : self.zendesk_api_email,
            'token' : self.zendesk_api_key,
            'subdomain': self.zendesk_api_subdomain
        }
        zenpy_client = Zenpy(**credentials)
        
        ticket = zenpy_client.tickets(id=self.ticket_id)

        #ticket.tags.append(self.category)
        for custom_field in ticket.custom_fields:
            if self.category_field_id == custom_field["id"]: # category
                custom_field["value"] = self.category
        
        ticket_audit = zenpy_client.tickets.update(ticket)
        
        #message = Message(text=str(ticket_audit.ticket.id))
        message = Message(text=self.category)
        self.status = message
        return message

# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
import re
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from zenpy import Zenpy
from zenpy.lib.api_objects import Ticket, Comment


class CustomComponent(Component):
    display_name = "ZenDesk Ticket Subject"
    description = "Get ZenDesk Ticket Subject"
    documentation: str = ""
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "ZenDesk Ticket Subject"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="ticket_id", display_name="Ticket ID", value=""),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="zendesk_api_key",
            display_name="ZenDesk API Key",
            info="The ZenDesk API Key",
            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_KEY",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="zendesk_api_email",
            display_name="ZenDesk API Email",
            info="The ZenDesk API Email",
            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_EMAIL",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="zendesk_api_subdomain",
            display_name="ZenDesk API Subdomain",
            info="The ZenDesk API Subdomain",
            advanced=False,
            value="ZENDESK_API_SUBDOMAIN",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Ticket Subject", name="text", method="build_subject"),
    ]

    def build_subject(self) -> Message:
        credentials = {
            'email' : self.zendesk_api_email,
            'token' : self.zendesk_api_key,
            'subdomain': self.zendesk_api_subdomain
        }
        zenpy_client = Zenpy(**credentials)
        ticket = zenpy_client.tickets(id=self.ticket_id)
        subject = ticket.subject
        self.status = subject
        return Message(text=subject)

code.value:
from axiestudio.base.data.utils import IMG_FILE_TYPES, TEXT_FILE_TYPES
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FileInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"
    name = "ChatInput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            value="",
            info="Message to be passed as input.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=["Machine", "User"],
            value="User",
            info="Type of sender.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value="User",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id", display_name="Session ID", info="Session ID for the message.", advanced=True
        ),
        FileInput(
            name="files",
            display_name="Files",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES + IMG_FILE_TYPES,
            info="Files to be sent with the message.",
            advanced=True,
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
            files=self.files,
        )

        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=["Machine", "User"],
            value="Machine",
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name", display_name="Sender Name", info="Name of the sender.", value="AI", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id", display_name="Session ID", info="Session ID for the message.", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message
